Single Word Screen¶

Contains the necessary functions and classes for the screen screen_single_word.

class screen_single_word.Tab(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: kivy.uix.floatlayout.FloatLayout, kivymd.uix.tab.MDTabsBase

Class implementing content for a tab.

icon[source]¶

StringProperty

id[source]¶

StringProperty

text[source]¶

StringProperty

class screen_single_word.TestApp(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: kivymd.app.MDApp

Application class, see module documentation for more information.

Events
on_start:

Fired when the application is being started (before the runTouchApp() call.

on_stop:

Fired when the application stops.

on_pause:

Fired when the application is paused by the OS.

on_resume:

Fired when the application is resumed from pause by the OS. Beware: you have no guarantee that this event will be fired after the on_pause event has been called.

Changed in version 1.7.0: Parameter kv_file added.

Changed in version 1.8.0: Parameters kv_file and kv_directory are now properties of App.

build(self)[source]¶

Initializes the application; it will be called only once. If this method returns a widget (tree), it will be used as the root widget and added to the window.

Returns

None or a root Widget instance if no self.root exists.

class screen_single_word.WordProperties(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: kivy.uix.boxlayout.BoxLayout

Consists of the UI-elements that display the data obtained by words.Word and lets the user choose which data to include on the card.

accept_suggestion(self, suggestion)[source]¶

Use Suggestion for new search.

complete_generation(self)[source]¶

Generate Anki card from current user selection and changes screen.

If the word was in the queue, returns to screen_queue. Else, resets the screen_single_word and changes to the edit_tab.

download_selected_image(self)[source]¶

Downloads the currently selected image to words.Word.base_path() + “.jpg”

get_user_selection_dict(self)[source]¶

Returns current user selection in the form needed by add_anki_card.

Example and explanation strings are tagged using utils.tag_word_in_sentence().

load_or_search(self, search_term)[source]¶

Searches for word, suggests alternative if not found and shows images.

refresh_data(self)[source]¶

Refresh UI with the data from words.Word.
